Sentence: True Son, Del, and Harry Butler travel back to Paxton township where True Son meets more of his (Son) family: his (Son) mother, Myra, who is sickly; his (Son) younger brother, Gordie; and his (Son) Aunt Kate

True Son cannot sleep the night of his (Son) return because he (Son) remembers the story his (Son) Indian father told him (Son) about the ', "``Paxton boys,''  (him)', 'a group of white settlers who brutally murdered some peaceful Conestoga Indians
The next day True Son meets more of his (Son) relatives, including his (Son) Uncle Wilse, who was a leader of the Paxton boys

Uncle Wilse is suspicious of True Son, and the two have a heated argument about whether the Paxton boys had the right to massacre children, an argument which results in Uncle Wilse slapping True Son across the face

True Son sneaks out with his (Son) cousin, but their reunion is bittersweet because True Son learns that Little Crane, who had accompanied Half Arrow to Paxton township, was killed by Uncle Wilse the previous night
